name: Nucleosome Dynamics
title: Nucleosome Dynamics Worflow
short_description: Nucleosome Dynamics Tools for performing  nucleosome-related analysis based on MNase-seq experimental data
long_description: The nucleosome dynamics worflow offers different tools to analyze nucleosome positioning from MNase-seq experimental data and to compare experiments to account for the transient and dynamic nature of nucleosome positioning under different cellular states. The main analyses included are nucleR, that performs Fourier transform filtering and peak calling to define nucleosome location, and NucleosomeDynamics, that compares different MNase-seq experiments at read level to identify variations in nucleosomes fuzzines and location (shifts, evictions, inclusions). Additionally, other nucleosome related features are studied, like nucleosome-free regions, prediction of nucleosome phasing at gene level, classification of transcription start sites based on the surrounding nucleosomes and nucleosome stiffness.

owner.author: Illa Ricard, Buitrago Diana, Brun Isabelle

input_files.name: MNaseSeq
input_files.help: MNase aligned reads in which nucleosome analyses are to be carried out. Multiple files can be given here, and for each, the selected analyses are going to be performed.

input_files.name: condition1
input_files.help: MNase data used to define the initial state  when comparing nucleosome positioning

input_files.name: condition2
input_files.help: MNase data used to define the final state  when comparing nucleosome positioning

input_files_public_dir.name: refGenome_chromSizes
input_files_public_dir.description: Folder where the information about the chromosome sizes of the reference genome is found

arguments.name: nucleR
arguments.help: NucleR finds nucleosome positions from MNase experiments using Fourier transform filtering and classifies nucleosomes according to their fuzziness

arguments.name: nucleR:width
arguments.help: Size of each nucleosome, in bp, to be considered by NucleR

arguments.name: nucleR:minoverlap
arguments.help: Minimum overlap between two nucleosomes for merging them.

arguments.name: nucleR:dyad_length
arguments.help: Length of the reads that should be used for nucleosome calling to define the dyad of the nucleosomes keeping the given number of bases around the center of the read.

arguments.name: nucleR:threshold
arguments.help: Minimum number of reads (Coverage) to call a nucleosome. Can be given as a percentage (i.e., '25%' means that the peaks with coverage in the 1st quartile of data won't be considered); or as an absolute coverage value (i.e., '20' means that the peaks with less than 20 reads per million of mapped reads won't be considered). Default = 35%.

arguments.name: nucleR:thresholdPercentage
arguments.help: Minimum number of reads (Coverage) to call a nucleosome given as percentage (i.e., '25%' means that the peaks with coverage in the 1st quartile of data won't be considered).

arguments.name: nucleR:thresholdValue
arguments.help: Minimum number of reads (Coverage) to call a nucleosome (i.e., '20' means that the peaks with less than 20 reads per million of mapped reads won't be considered).

arguments.name: nucleR:hthresh
arguments.help: Height threshold (between 0 and 1) to classify a nucleosome as fuzzy (class=F) or well-positioned ( class=W) according to the number of reads at the dyad. Nucleosomes below this value will be defined as fuzzy. Default = 0.4.

arguments.name: nucleR:wthresh
arguments.help: Width threshold (between 0 and 1) to classify a nucleosome as fuzzy (class=F) or well-positioned (class=W) according to the dispersion of the reads around the dyad.

arguments.name: nucleR:pcKeepComp
arguments.help: Parameter used in the smoothing when Fourier transformation is applied. Number of components to select with respect to the total size of the sample. llowed values are numeric (in range 0:1) for manual setting, or auto for automatic detection.

arguments.name: nucDyn
arguments.help: Detection of local changes in the position of nucleosomes at the single read level observed between two reference nucleosome maps

arguments.name: nucDyn:range
arguments.help: Genomic region to be analyzed: whole genome ('all', entire chromosome (chromosome name i.e. 'chrX'), or region of a chromosome ('chromosomeName:start-end).

arguments.name: nucDyn:maxDiff
arguments.help: Maximum distance between the dyads of two reads that allows them to still be considered a shift. If unspecified but readSize is specified, it will be set to the half of readSize. If neither of them is specified, it will be set to 70

arguments.name: nucDyn:maxLen
arguments.help: Used in the preliminar filtering. Reads longer than this number will be filtered out

arguments.name: nucDyn:shift_min_nreads
arguments.help: Minimum number of reads in a 'SHIFT +' or a 'SHIFT -' hotspot

arguments.name: nucDyn:shift_threshold
arguments.help: Minimum score for a 'SHIFT +' or a 'SHIFT -' hotspot

arguments.name: nucDyn:indel_min_nreads
arguments.help: Minimum number of reads in an 'INCLUSION +' or a 'DELETION -' hotspot

arguments.name: nucDyn:indel_threshold
arguments.help: Minimum score for an 'INCLUSION' or a 'DELETION' hotspot

arguments.name: nucDyn:equal_size
arguments.help: If set to TRUE, all sets will be set to the same length, conserving their original dyad position

arguments.name: nucDyn:readSize
arguments.help: Length to which all reads will be set in case 'equalSize' is TRUE

arguments.name: NFR
arguments.help: Nucleosome-free regions (NFR) are regions depleted of nucleosomes and larger than an average linker fragment.

arguments.name: NFR:minwidth
arguments.help: Minimum width for a linker fragment to be considered a nucleosome-free region

arguments.name: NFR:threshold
arguments.help: Maximum width for a linker fragment to be considered a nucleosome-free region

arguments.name: periodicity
arguments.help: Nucleosome phasing along a given gene between the first and last nucleosome

arguments.name: periodicity:periodicity
arguments.help: Average distance between two consecutive nucleosomes (repeat length).

arguments.name: txstart
arguments.help: Classification of the Transcription Start Sites (TSS) according to the nucleosome architecture.

arguments.name: txstart:window
arguments.help: Number of nucleotides on each side of the TSS where -1 and +1 nucleosome are search for.

arguments.name: txstart:open_thresh
arguments.help: Distance between nucleosomes -1 and +1 to discriminate between 'open' and 'close' classes.

arguments.name: gausfitting
arguments.help: Measure of the resistance of a given nucleosome to be displaced, derived from the properties of the nucleosome calls fitted into a Gaussian distribution.

arguments.name: gausfitting:range
arguments.help: Genomic region to be analyzed: whole genome ('all', entire chromosome (chromosome name i.e. 'chrX'), or region of a chromosome ('chromosomeName:start-end).
